trans-unit.source: Exchange ActiveSync policy settings | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Exchange ActiveSync policy settings | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use the Intune Exchange ActiveSync policy to configure settings that let you control features and functionality on devices managed by Exchange ActiveSync.
trans-unit.target: Use the Intune Exchange ActiveSync policy to configure settings that let you control features and functionality on devices managed by Exchange ActiveSync.

trans-unit.source: Exchange ActiveSync policy settings in Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Exchange ActiveSync policy settings in Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use the Microsoft Intune **Exchange ActiveSync** policy to configure settings that control a range of features and functionality on devices that are managed by Exchange ActiveSync.
trans-unit.target: Use the Microsoft Intune **Exchange ActiveSync** policy to configure settings that control a range of features and functionality on devices that are managed by Exchange ActiveSync.

trans-unit.source: Password settings
trans-unit.target: Password settings

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: **Require a password to unlock mobile devices**
trans-unit.target: **Require a password to unlock mobile devices**

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether devices must be locked by using a password.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether devices must be locked by using a password.

trans-unit.source: (not applicable to devices running Windows RT).
trans-unit.target: (not applicable to devices running Windows RT).

trans-unit.source: **Required password type**
trans-unit.target: **Required password type**

trans-unit.source: Specifies the type of password that will be required, such as numeric only or alphanumeric.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the type of password that will be required, such as numeric only or alphanumeric.

trans-unit.source: **Minimum password length**
trans-unit.target: **Minimum password length**

trans-unit.source: Specifies the minimum number of required characters in the device password.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the minimum number of required characters in the device password.

trans-unit.source: **Allow simple passwords**
trans-unit.target: **Allow simple passwords**

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether you can use simple passwords, which include ‘0000’ and ‘1234’.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether you can use simple passwords, which include ‘0000’ and ‘1234’.

trans-unit.source: **Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped**
trans-unit.target: **Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped**

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of times that a user can enter an incorrect password before the device is wiped.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of times that a user can enter an incorrect password before the device is wiped.

trans-unit.source: **Password expiration (days)**
trans-unit.target: **Password expiration (days)**

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of days after which the device password must be changed.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of days after which the device password must be changed.

trans-unit.source: **Remember password history**
trans-unit.target: **Remember password history**

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether to not allow the use of previously used passwords.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether to not allow the use of previously used passwords.

trans-unit.source: **Remember password history** – **Prevent reuse of previous passwords**
trans-unit.target: **Remember password history** – **Prevent reuse of previous passwords**

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of previously used passwords that can't be used again.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of previously used passwords that can't be used again.

trans-unit.source: **Minutes of inactivity before password is required**
trans-unit.target: **Minutes of inactivity before password is required**

trans-unit.source: Specifies the amount of time that a device must be idle before the screen is locked.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the amount of time that a device must be idle before the screen is locked.

trans-unit.source: Encryption settings
trans-unit.target: Encryption settings

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: **Require encryption on mobile device**<sup>1</sup>
trans-unit.target: **Require encryption on mobile device**<sup>1</sup>

trans-unit.source: Requires the data on a device to be encrypted when supported.
trans-unit.target: Requires the data on a device to be encrypted when supported.

trans-unit.source: For Windows Phone 8 devices, you must set this to **Yes**.
trans-unit.target: For Windows Phone 8 devices, you must set this to **Yes**.

trans-unit.source: To enable encryption on iOS devices, enable the **Require a password to unlock mobile devices** setting.
trans-unit.target: To enable encryption on iOS devices, enable the **Require a password to unlock mobile devices** setting.

trans-unit.source: **Require encryption on storage cards**
trans-unit.target: **Require encryption on storage cards**

trans-unit.source: Requires data that is stored on external storage such as an SD card to be encrypted (on supported devices).
trans-unit.target: Requires data that is stored on external storage such as an SD card to be encrypted (on supported devices).

trans-unit.source: <sup>1</sup> Additional information for devices that run Windows 8.1
trans-unit.target: <sup>1</sup> Additional information for devices that run Windows 8.1

trans-unit.source: If you want to enforce encryption on devices that run Windows 8.1, you must install the [December 2014 MDM client update for Windows](http://support.microsoft.com/kb/3013816) on each device.
trans-unit.target: If you want to enforce encryption on devices that run Windows 8.1, you must install the [December 2014 MDM client update for Windows](http://support.microsoft.com/kb/3013816) on each device.

trans-unit.source: If you enable this setting for Windows 8.1 devices, all users of the device must have a Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: If you enable this setting for Windows 8.1 devices, all users of the device must have a Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: If you want encryption to work for Windows 8.1 devices, the device must meet the Microsoft [InstantGo](http://blogs.windows.com/bloggingwindows/2014/06/19/instantgo-a-better-way-to-sleep/) hardware certification requirements.
trans-unit.target: If you want encryption to work for Windows 8.1 devices, the device must meet the Microsoft [InstantGo](http://blogs.windows.com/bloggingwindows/2014/06/19/instantgo-a-better-way-to-sleep/) hardware certification requirements.

trans-unit.source: If you enforce encryption on a Windows 8.1 device, the recovery key is only accessible from the user's Microsoft account, which is accessed from the user's OneDrive account.
trans-unit.target: If you enforce encryption on a Windows 8.1 device, the recovery key is only accessible from the user's Microsoft account, which is accessed from the user's OneDrive account.

trans-unit.source: You cannot recover this key on behalf of a user.
trans-unit.target: You cannot recover this key on behalf of a user.

trans-unit.source: Email settings
trans-unit.target: Email settings

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: **Allow users to download email attachments**
trans-unit.target: **Allow users to download email attachments**

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether email attachments can be downloaded to the device.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether email attachments can be downloaded to the device.

trans-unit.source: **Email synchronization period**
trans-unit.target: **Email synchronization period**

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of days of received email that will be synchronized to the device.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of days of received email that will be synchronized to the device.

trans-unit.source: **Allow mobile devices that don’t fully support Exchange ActiveSync settings to synchronize with Exchange**
trans-unit.target: **Allow mobile devices that don’t fully support Exchange ActiveSync settings to synchronize with Exchange**

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether to allow Exchange access on devices that don't support one or more Exchange ActiveSync settings.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether to allow Exchange access on devices that don't support one or more Exchange ActiveSync settings.

trans-unit.source: Browser settings
trans-unit.target: Browser settings

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: **Allow web browser**
trans-unit.target: **Allow web browser**

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the web browser on the device can be used.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the web browser on the device can be used.

trans-unit.source: (Not available for Windows RT or Windows Phone).
trans-unit.target: (Not available for Windows RT or Windows Phone).

trans-unit.source: Hardware settings
trans-unit.target: Hardware settings

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: **Allow camera**
trans-unit.target: **Allow camera**

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the camera on the device can be used.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the camera on the device can be used.

trans-unit.source: (Not available for Windows RT or Windows Phone).
trans-unit.target: (Not available for Windows RT or Windows Phone).
